Translations.Text: And if We had made him an Angel, We would indeed have made him a man, and We would indeed have confounded for them whatever they are confounding
And indeed Messengers were already mocked at even before you; then what they were scoffing at redounded upon the ones who mocked at them
Say, "Travel in the earth; thereafter look into how was the end of the beliers

Say, "To whom (belongs) whatever is in the heavens and the earth?" Say, "To Allah." He has prescribed for Himself (the) mercy. Indeed He will definitely gather you to the Day of the Resurrection; there is no suspicion about it. The ones who have lost their (own) selves; so they do not believe
And to Him belongs whatever rests in the night and the daytime; and He is The Ever-Hearing, The Ever-Knowing

Say, "Shall I take to myself as constant patron other than Allah, The Originator (Literally: The Renderer) of the heavens and the earth, and He is (The One) Who feeds, and is not fed?" Say, "Surely I have been commanded to be the first of the ones who have surrendered, " (i.e. who have become Muslims) and definitely do not be of the associators (i.e., those who associate others with Allah)
Say, "Surely I fear, in case I disobey my Lord, the torment of a tremendous Day
From whomever it is turned about (i.e., it "torment" is turned away) upon that Day, then He will have mercy on him; and that is the evident triumph
And in case Allah touches you with an adversity, then none (can) lift it off except He, and in case He touches you with charity, (i.e., benefit, welfare) then He is Ever-Determiner over everything
And He is The Vanquisher above His bondmen, and He is The Ever-Wise, The Ever-Cognizant
